Events and trends *1279 BCâPharaoh Seti I dies. *c. 1279 BCâTroy VI, speculated
to be the city mentioned in Homer's Iliad, is presumed to have been destroyed by
Greek armies. *c. 1279 BC (May 31)âRamesses II (19th dynasty) becomes pharaoh of
Ancient Egypt. *c. 1279 BCâ1213 BCâTemple of Ramesses II in Abu Simbel, Nubia
(19th dynasty) was built. Wall painting of Queen Nefertari making an offering to
the god Isis in the tomb of Nefertari was made. The tomb is located in the
Valley of the Queens in Egypt. *c. 1279 BC â 1213 BCâTemple of Amun, Mut and
Khons, Luxor, Nineteenth dynasty of Egypt, is built. *1278 BCâRamesses II
defeats the Shardana sea pirates. *1274 BCâThe Battle of Kadesh (or Battle of
Qadesh) in Syria, regarded as the largest (5â6,000) chariot vs. chariot battle
in antiquity. The end of the Battle of Kadesh was followed by some 15 years of
border warfare ended by the signing of the earliest known peace treaty between
the Hittites and Egyptians, the Treaty of Qadesh. *1274 BCâShalmaneser I becomes
King of the Assyrian Empire.
